title: H2020 Innovation and Research opportunities for ICT in Education
segmentation: Thank you very much.
Mary, ladies and gentlemen.
It's indeed my pleasure to be with you today and I should admit I'm very happy.
I'm hearing you Beana and I have a rare opportunity to be in my hometown and speaking this beautiful hole.

So, ladies and gentlemen, the objective of my presentation is actually to share with you some information about the opportunities which will exist or Richard exist in the context of European support for research innovation in this respective domain.
But before I do so, I would like to stress that I'm very happy to also welcome open up Slovenia initiative.

And I would like to highlight to you that the initiative which we started also in European Union level has been prepared by jointly my my boss, Vice President Nellie Cruz and Commissioner Basileo and I think it is respect the dimension which has been presented here is very very important.
However, let me get back to the research innovation.
I want to insist that very often researchers are blamed that they do a lot of interesting things.
They create a lot of new knowledge.

But at the same time they will blame that this knowledge is retained within labs within labs, within universities or institutes, and it's not used and widely shared with the SoC with industry and so on.
And I think listening to what is going on over here and knowing quite a lot about the excellent experience of videolecture.net.
I think this is a clear example of how.
Researchers, if they want, can work differently and can act completely differently.
Videolectures.net is actually excellent example where a lot of work has been done by researchers in developing new technologies.
At the same time, using these technologies in very open way in the domain of the education.
So I think in this respect it's very important to recognize that.
Exactly this kind of thinking, this kind of actually mindset change.
Should should happen everywhere in European Union and I think for that we can really achieve the policy objectives which we have set up set up.
I also would like to recognize that this is not just the achievement.
Which has been recognized by by.
If you want national authorities of Slovenia, but also UNESCO gave to videolecture.net.
An award for the best Science and technology product of the decade earlier this year.
So this is a major achievement and like just to to subscribe through to this excellent technology.
Acknowledgement to videolectures.net.
But let me get back to the my presentation.
What I would like to do is actually just very briefly talk about.
But our general policy setting, I don't think I need to spend a lot of time on this BIH cause much has been already set by both Commissioner Basilio as well as administer picolo.
I would like them to later on talk a bit about challenges and scope.
And of course I will focus on research innovation opportunities which are already here in work program of the Horizon 2020 implementation for 2014 and 15.
And then I try to wrap up with some brief conclusions.
So let me start with.
With the general problem setting, if you want as you know Internet as such has dramatically changed the lives of citizens in many different ways.
And however, at the same time your education is failing to keep pace with the digital society and the economy.
So there are huge potentials for digital technologies.
To offer you better education, better training in this respect, I think it's very important to recall just some basic facts and figures from the reports which were recently published.
For example, one of the in one of the figure which I'd like to to memorize is that a bit more than 60% of nine years old in in Europe are still without access to digital equipment.
That's that's a major challenge.
Also, I think at the same time we have to recognize that fast broadband is widely available throughout European Union.
If you talk about a competency's and skills, for example only 20 to 25% of students are taught by digitally confident and supportive teachers.
And when asked about 50 to 80% of the students said that they never used digital textbooks or they never used exercise software or broadcasted.
Broadcasted learning, learning, or learning games.
I think these are major challenges, but at the same time these are very important opportunities which are in front of us.
This is exactly why.
In the digital agenda for Europe and I just like to remind to remind you that digital agenda for Europe was adopted in 2010 as one of the major one of seven pillars of the Europe 2020 strategy.
We have very clearly highlighted the need to work on these opportunities.
So.

May I now take the opportunity to challenge the audience an inquire whether our education and training systems are really delivering their competence is needed by the economy and society, including, for example, the collaboration problem, solving creativity, innovation, and high level conceptual skills?
And all this, as you know, very well are needed for the jobs today and tomorrow.
How can we keep education and training relevant in a global interconnected world, anywhere, anytime, anyplace?
At the same time, I would like to recall that.
We face in European Union the major.
The major shortage of people with come with the ICT skills.
Recent study actually showed that somewhere between 500,000 and 900,000 ICT specials professionals will be needed by 2020.
At the same time, for example, why?
Are European students not interested in pursuing their careers in steam?
It is already, as you know, hindering the future competitive advantage of European Union.
It's clear that we must work out these challenges.

Ensuring that our education and training systems are first of all, they have to promote and deliver excellence in relevant 24 of 21st century skills, including through pervasive access to digital learning.
We have also.
To see how how we can ensure adequacy between skills and employment market.
And also we have to see how we can support a triple play of innovation, inclusion and economic impacts and growth and jobs.
So I think through this we have we have facilitated three very important recent U actions.
As I said, I don't want to go in details from them.
Becausw much has been already said bye bye Commissioner Basileo.
However, one very important one is Grand Coalition is opening up Education 2013.
Another very important one is Grand Coalition for digital jobs.
It was launched just recently and it's actually a EU wide multi stakeholder partnership aiming to address mismatches and fill vacancies in our city practitioners to boost the employment as I said.
Addressing the challenges in respect of shortage of people with ICT skills.

And these grand coalition for digital Jobs has been quite successful so far because we managed to do is bring together different stakeholders, most notably the company school, beginning job, public authorities and also different entities for making very concrete pledges in order to address these challenges.
And last but not least, we have also launched Horizon 2020, which you know is the New Year Framework program for supporting research innovation.
Um?
So in this context, allow me just to share with you very briefly.
Findings for Slovenia on the EU survey of schools.
The aim of this study was actually to benchmark 28 EU member states and also Iceland, Norway and Turkey.
In respect of the ICT education by serving students, lead teachers teachers on their ability and use including options and attitudes of ICT in schools.
A number of findings were very important.
Very interesting, so they highlighted, for example, results in terms of the equipment.

On the on terms of competences and so on, and students, for example of Slovenia, have said that they have lower level of access compared to the EU mean, but at the same time they said that the higher level of high speed broadband provisions is available.
Also, levels of connectedness in Slovenia is higher compared to the EU level.
As for the frequency of use of technology, frequency of use by teachers is generally in Slovenia above EU mean.
However, we see that for some levels, most notably for lower grades, it is below you mean.
So both teachers and students confidence in their ICT skills is somewhere around the EU level.
Professional development in ICT seems to be in Slovenia rather uneven.

Specially on compared to low and high grades in this respect, I think there is a lot of opportunity for Slovenia to promote what they are doing very well, but the same time to address the challenges which.
No, we just living is facing so results are to some extent very very encouraging.
However, I would like to insist that there is quite a lot of room for improvement.

In this respect, I would just like to recall that Slovenia is now finalizing all the operational documents which will be used by Slovenia for for using the Structural Funds and what we would like to see, of course is the prominent position of the ICT.
And of course most notably the use of ICT education in the relevant documents which are being now finalized in Slovenia.
Let me now get through Horizon 2020, which I said is the core of my presentation.
As you know, Horizon 2020 has been adopted to already nearly two years ago.
It went through legislative process.
And by the end of last year 2013, which we have launched, the first course of project proposals.

Horizon 2020, of course, is continuation to some extent of 7th Framework Program, but the same time it actually brings together the 7th Framework Programme Competitiveness Innovation Program and European Institute for Innovation and Technologies are funding instrument for it.
At the same time, I think the logic the idea of Horizon 2020 is to some extent radically different compared to the previous framework program.
Objective Horizon 2020 is to focus activities along three pillars.
Pillars addressing excellence in science pillars pillar addressing support for leadership in competitiveness and pillar for addressing societal challenges.
However, all these pillars together our support one way or the other to our support.
Supposed to support major challenges, which European Union is facing.
One other innovative part of Horizon 2020 is that we would like to have in Horizon 2020 much more innovation.

For example, we have also some new new instruments, risk finance instruments prices at the same time we're trying to bring together and fund's support new communities, for example through through collective platforms.
And also we are trying to support new approaches for innovation like for example support to enterpreneurs.
In parallel to this we are trying to have Horizon 2020 as simple as possible.
In this in respect, the time to Grant is supposed to be shorter and at the same time all the instruments will be simpler compared to the past.
So first first pillar for four.
Of course, in 2020, as I said, is the excellent science part.
Excellent science part has actually.
Qnective is actually to address and to support research in groundbreaking new domains.
For ICT domain, for example, there is a special part which is called future and emerging technologies.
So we have three different parts of future emerging technologies.
One is fat open which is actually looking for new ideas.
When we kept proactive and fat flagships at the same time, we are supporting research infrastructures.
So for example we are developing European research infrastructure for Horizon 2020 and beyond and.
It's very important domain which facilitates support for research and.
And for research and actually basic.
Or if you want basic research then very important domain is.
Is societal challenges pillow substantial societal challenges?
Bill actually tries to address the major concerns which are shared by by European citizens, so these are concerns, for example, of climate change or environment of energy and transport.
It has a number of very important if you want even horizontal issues like interoperability, reuse and economies of scale and so on and ICT as such.
They have a number of different activities.
They range for example from research to market with new focus on interoperability through market, employment, information for future digital policy, and so on and so on.
Hub then we have financially the largest pillar.

Is the industrial leadership pillar which aims at speeding up development for technology innovation that will underpin tomorrow's businesses and help innovative European SMS to grow into world leading companies.
This is a set financially.
The largest part of Horizon 2020, and we have seen strategic investments in the domain of the ICT in this domain.
We have a number of specific areas for research.
One is new generation for components and systems.
Then we have next generation computing.
Then we have future Internet.
Content technologies and information management.
Advanced interface and robots and microelectronics and photonics.
From the perspective of the of the content, what we're talking about here today meaning ICT and education.
It has been established as one of very important domains in the content, knowledge technologies and information management.
So in this Fort part of the ICT industry leadership pillar you have a very prominent role in that domain.
So.
Let me just assure you that the ICT education has and remains to be a very important area of research, innovation, portfolio.
As you probably know, since 2007 and as has been shown by by previous speakers today morning, we invested quite a lot of money in research innovation in the 7th Framework Program over in the.
Only seven framework programme refunded altogether.
About 50 three projects with nearly 200 million euros.
In this in this field.
In past investments actually focused on several areas.
First of all, for example, we found we are funding understanding on how ICT can improve learning processes and digital teaching practices.
We're also funding a number of projects on the central role of ICT in personalization, meaning how to work together on the addressing individuals needs.
We are funding a number of projects on model for future classroom.
Essentially merging together technology and teaching practices.
Also one very important domain of the 7th Framework Program in this domain was to fund innovative tools.
Like for example, serious games, emotive computing, elaborate if learning tools, and so on.
Then we also funded learning analytics.
And last but not least, we also promoted a number of large scale pilots for design of classroom of the of the 21st century.
So this was the focus of the Seven Framework Program now.
Oh yeah, in the current in the in Horizon 2020, we are planning to launch ICT call what we call a city called 20.
Very soon it will be launched in September this year.
And we will make available 52 million euros for supporting it.
The objectives of of of that will be, for example, first of all.
First of all I would like to support multidisciplinary research, expanding and experimentation.
So smart environments for adaptive and personalized learning and assessment.
Here we would like to see essentially how to address comprising.
Neuroscience, pedagogical and learning theories.
Education, psychology as well as artificial intelligence.
We would also like to see a number of projects which will be focusing on adaptive and personalized learning and assessment.
Toro Multimedia multi sensory interaction technologies and advanced interfaces.
Also.
We have foreseen a number of.

A number of very specific domains we would like to have an an industry let meaning in collaboration with Academy of course, and they were for innovation, interoperability and deployment of digital learning services in different learning scenarios.
You see the budget which is there.
Which is free 5 million euros?
Then we would like to have a large scale pilot in real setting, development and integrating innovative digital educational tools, solutions and services in learning and teaching practices.
We would like her to have pilots to develop innovative technologies for learning, including, for example, adaptive solutions, learning analytics, augmented reality, mobile learning, etc.
And also would like to address standards for interactive content composition and reuse and and distribution.
And adaptation into learning scenarios.
Up then.
One of the objective is also to have to procure innovative solutions for digital learning and teaching.
And.
I think for that we could really achieve the policy objectives which are very clearly spelled out by by Mr Piccolo and Commissioner Basilio.
So the expected results of all these projects are to first of all, reinforce European leadership in this domain.
Also would like to promote the emergence of new innovative businesses speed up the rate of technology adoption in this domain and contribute to opening up education.
Last but not least, I think it will be very important to use this instrument for developing new public private partnerships in this domain.
So, ladies and gentlemen, I think for us we're in stage where as I said by September this year will make a substantial funding available for supporting research and innovation.

However, it will be very important that when you respond to this school, you look at all the other opportunities which are being made available for this domain beat European structure funds at asthma says it has been presented by.
Commissioner Basilio today or national funds which are made which are being made available in Slovenia or other EU member states.
For this I think we can really support what you are doing and I think for this we can really address the global challenges which we are facing.
Last but not least ladies and gentlemen, I think it's important to recognize that only by working together we can really make it happen.

In this respect, I want to insist that we are now in European Union on level of transition from the Commission, which will which is now still in place and the new Commission which will take office by full this year.
What I would like to inform you is that.
By beginning of summer, this year we will launch what we call the public consultation which will help us to shape the policies of the new European Commission.
This public consultation will be open throughout summer and what we would like to get from you are you thoughts, your experiences and also your suggestions.
You recommendations for the future.
It would be very important to get from this constituency new stimulus for policymaking on European Union.
Anyone if you want on the global level and I think through this we can help the new Commission to have the right elements in place which will help it create and shape up its new policies.
I think so very much for your attention and once again, my apologies for the mess for the slides at the beginning.
Thank you very much.
You did mention that it was important that these are projects should help the community and have a real impact.
But then in the second part of the presentation reach 2020, I've failed to actually see where where the let's say the new objects that would allow that to happen.
Are you suggesting that the answers to the different calls should be integrated?
Answers?
Are you suggesting that?
Somehow that is going to be scrutinized in a different way.
Thank you very much for the question.
So what we're trying to do is actually compared to the 7th Framework Programme, change the logic of working 7 Framework Program had if you want it's it's specific specific pillars.
We didn't communicate very much with each other at the same time.
We were really in the 7th Framework Program, working on on research what we would like now to do with Horizon 2020 is actually bring all these different stakeholders together.
So I think in the domain of the.
ICT for education.
You have a wealth of knowledge which was created through different activities which you did in the past and I think now.
We have to see how first of all to bring this knowledge to.
If you want to the market.
Yeah, so offer it to the policymakers, but at the same time what we are recognizing is that there is still need to do additional research.
And I mentioned the areas where this should be done the way we think it should be done.
So for us, what you know, what we would like to see is that for example, the consorts.
Yeah, the way the consortium will be made for research and innovation project will be if you want much more colorful.
So we would like to have much more if you want policymakers would like to have more educational institutions in as partners in the consortia would like to have the NGOs would like to, so in a way.
We would like to have.
Stakeholders on who could later on so participate in the research itself, but the same time take, you know, take take the fruits of the results of the research further.
Of course, there is the issue of the sustainability of the research projects later on, so we don't want to have just the research which was then remain and floats and remain unused.
I would like to have the uptake of the research results much better and much more efficient compared to what we had in the past.
So as I understand, are every year, so every work package is focused on some certain topic, not certain but are on on the role of topics, number of topics here.
So can you somehow for C or is it already known what will be focusing like last years next year?
Sorry.
Yes, thank you very much for the question.
I should admit that despite I was talking about the simplicity of the 7th day of the Horizon, 2020 is still a very complex animal.
However, specially different kind of research organizations, meaning, institutes, universities.
They have all the infrastructure, so they are very knowledgeable about the, you know the machinery of these calls.
We have published a number of calls already.
Altogether I think it work program 2014 and 2000, 2015.
We have nearly nearly 100 calls.
The call #20 will be published in September and it will have those specific domains which I wish I mentioned.
Now, in parallel with the publication of this course, we are preparing the work program 16 and 17, so we're looking.
We're usually working.
I mean, we're working on two year cycles on Work Pro, so we didn't want to have a longer cycle because we wanted to have the flexibility to address new emerging things.
So the work program 16 and 17 is prepared in different steps.
First, we work with.
With what we have, the Advisory Advisory Group Advisory Group is giving us specific recommendations on knee on new things which we have to address.
Then after that we present this to the Member States representatives and on the basis of that we prepare then document which is then shared with the general public.
And after that consultation, we prepare the work program 60.
We prepare the work program 16 and 17 in this stage.
I I'm not in a position to share with you what will be in the work program 16 or 17 dispatch.
We are already working on that, but I don't think it would be fair to share this to the general public public.

So my message right now today is used the best opportunities for which will exist as of September for the work program 2015 and at the same time, if you have specific ideas, what else needs to be done, send us.
Send us your thoughts.
And we would like to take this further later on.
Thank you very much.
So one more time, let us please thank you Doctor Standage for your presentation this morning and your flexibility and.
